page.title: 05Keswicks Parks
page.content: More than a century ago,the old Fitz Park was made.In the early 1880's,a group of men started the park which is situated on the bank's of the River Greta.The New Park is more or less for older people to play games like bowls,and in summer,tennis.In the New Park there is a golf course.The Old Park has now got a B.M.X course.The course was made a few months ago.Before the B.M.X course was made,there used to be sheep trials but they cannot be any now.The Old Park has also got some swings. In the summer visitors use Crow Park (by Lake Derwentwater) as an area of enjoyment.It is known as a bathing area.Last year in 1984 there was a service where the churches of Keswick gathered together.The service was a Holy Communion.It was an Easter Service so there was an Easter Play.
